thread.title: Classic moments of Rene in 'Allo! 'Allo! as star of BBC sitcom Gorden Kaye dies at 75
thread.title_full: Classic moments of Rene in 'Allo! 'Allo! as star of BBC sitcom Gorden Kaye dies at 75

author: Scott Campbell
title: Classic moments of Rene in 'Allo! 'Allo! as star of BBC sitcom Gorden Kaye dies at 75
text:
TV Classic moments of Rene in 'Allo! 'Allo! as star of BBC sitcom Gorden Kaye dies at 75 Mirror Online has pulled together the best moments from all nine series of ‘Allo! ‘Allo! – from Officer Crabtree's "good moaning" to Michelle's hilarious catchphrase "listen carefully, I shall say zis only once" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now VIDEO: Classic moments of Rene in Allo Allo Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
It’s one of Britain’s best-loved sitcoms – with its tongue-in-cheek portrayals of bumbling Nazis and long-running jokes still resonating with audiences 35 years after it first hit TV screens. 
'Allo 'Allo! has come back into the spotlight today after the tragic death of its main star Gorden Kaye – who is best known for his role as Rene Artois in the comedy – at age 75. 
He appeared in all 84 episodes of the BBC show for a decade until 1992, and reprised the role 1,200 times in the stage adaptation. Read More 
Gorden would later return to the role in 2007 in a one-off TV revival, and a stage show in Australia that summer. Gorden Kaye has died at the age of 75 (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Allo Allo's René in classic scene where he finds out lover is pregnant Share this video Watch Next 
Mirror Online has pulled together the best moments from all nine series of ‘Allo! ‘Allo! – from Officer Crabtree's "good moaning" to beret-wearing Michelle's hilarious catchphrase "listen carefully, I shall say this only once". 
There were hopes last year that the BBC might revive the sitcom but ultimately the show was not shortlisted unlike other classics such as Porridge and Are You Being Served. Gorden starred in every episode of the classic BBC sitcom (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Actress Vicki Michelle hit out at TV bosses amid rumours that the decision was taken over fears that the characters could offend viewers. 
It was thought that viewers might take offence to its portrayal of Germans as bumbling Nazis, particularly the Gestapo officer Herr Flick. Read More The fascinating tale behind Gorden Kaye's oddly spelt name: 'Allo 'Allo! actor remembered 
Vicki, 65, who played sexy French waitress Yvette Carte-Blanche in the show, said at the time: “I cannot stand political correctness. 
"Where is the sense of humour? If you can’t take a bit of ridicule, you’re not human." Like us on Facebook
